intro: Rhus jaliscana, commonly known as the Mexican sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like the poison ivy and cashew. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several oval-shaped leaflets. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fuzzy berries, which are an important food source for birds and wildlife. Rhus jaliscana is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
